gw.api.web.accounting

Class BC9130FixUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • gw.api.web.accounting.BC9130FixUtil
  • Deprecated. 
    (since 8.0.0) This utility fixes BC-9130 and should not be used for any other reason.

    @Deprecated
public class BC9130FixUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    Class to fix the data that has been corrupted by BC-9130. This corrupted data would occur when we reversed an Invoice Item that had a Gross Write-Off against it. What would happen in this case is the denorm value "GrossAmountWrittenOff" would be copied onto the reversal, even though the reversal should have zero gross write-offs against it, and the write-offs that are targeting the reversed are about to reversed anyway. What then happened was the reversal invoice item showed an incorrect GrossUnsettledAmount, for instance, if the InvoiceItem was for -$5, and the GrossWrittenOffAmount on the original was $3, then the GrossUnsettledAmount on the reversal would show as -$8 instead of the -$5 it should be. This results in over-payments when we try to use the reversal to pay off the reversed, and unexpected past due amounts.

      static IQueryBeanResult<InvoiceItem> fixCorruptedDataFromReversingInvoiceItemsWithGrossWriteOffs(Bundle bundle)

    • Constructor Detail

    • Method Detail

      • fixCorruptedDataFromReversingInvoiceItemsWithGrossWriteOffs

        public static IQueryBeanResult<InvoiceItem> fixCorruptedDataFromReversingInvoiceItemsWithGrossWriteOffs(Bundle bundle)
        Deprecated. 
        Fixes the data corrupted by BC-9130. First finds all of the reversal invoice items that have a non zero GrossAmountWrittenOff. This is incorrect. The GrossAmountWrittenOff on reversal invoice items should always be zero. It takes each of these corrupted reversal invoice items, and first sets the GrossAmountWrittenOff to zero. It then redistributes the ZeroDollarDMR that was used to pay of the reversed invoice item with this reversal, and redistributes the dist item against this reversal invoice item to the proper GrossUnsettledAmount (which should now be equal to the Gross Amount on the invoice item) now that the GrossAmountWrittenOff has been corrected, and re-executes the payment with this modification. This will correct the incorrect past due and paid amounts on the account and policy period respectively
        Parameters:
        bundle - The bundle that all of this data fix should take place in. The customer should commit this bundle if they would like to commit the data fix to the database. They should toss the bundle if they merely wish to test the data fix without making changes to the database.
        Returns:
        The set of reversal invoice items that had been corrupted by BC-9130 and that were fixed by this method
